bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to the New York Times, Book Review Department, March 14, 1925

div1.p: Kean discusses the Gorgas biography and requests that his review of it be published.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to the New York Times, Book Review Department, March 14, 1925
div1.opener:
March 14, 1925.
The New York Times,
Book Review Department,
New York City.
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
Enclosed is a reprint of a review of the recently
published biography of General Gorgas by Marie D. Gorgas and
Burton J. Hendrick, Doubleday, Page & Company, publishers.
It was published as an editorial in the March issue of The
Military Surgeon of which I am editor. General M. W. Ireland,
Surgeon General of the Army, has been greatly pleased with
this review and thinks that it is due to the memory of Walter
Reed that it should have a wider and more general circulation
than the readers of The Military Surgeon. He has asked me,
therefore, to send it to you with a request and authority to
publish it in whole or in part in The New York Times.

I might add that the statements in the review have
been approved by Major General W. M. Black, late Chief of
Engineers, as regards the cleaning up of Havana, and Dr. L. O.
Howard, Chief of the Bureau of Entomology, Agriculture Depart-
ment, as regards Reed's connection with the warfare against
mosquitoes. My own knowledge in the matter is first hand
because I was at the time Chief Surgeon of the Department of
Havana Province in which Reed's work was carried on and was in
daily contact with him during that time. I had also an offi-
cial connection with the Reed Commission as General Wood placed
in my hands for the disbursement the funds which he appropriated
from the Cuban Treasury for the purposes of the yellow fever
experiment.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, J. R. KEAN
Colonel, U.S. Army, Retired,
Editor. JRK/W
